0.jd:
JD: 

Stripe Product Manager with 5+ years of experience. 

Lead the strategic vision and execution of product initiatives in the Risk and Compliance domain, ensuring alignment with Stripe’s broader goals and market needs

•

Drive product development from conception to launch, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, marketing, and legal

•

Champion a user-centric approach in product design and development, balancing user needs with regulatory compliance and risk management

•

Oversee and guide the product roadmap, prioritizing features and initiatives that align with business objectives and deliver maximum impact

•

Act as a key decision-maker in defining product requirements and specifications, ensuring solutions are scalable, reliable, and deliver tangible value to users

•

Foster a culture of innovation and continuous improvement within the team, encouraging experimentation and learning from both successes and setbacks

•

Build and maintain strong relationships with internal stakeholders and external partners, effectively communicating product vision and progress

exp_chunks:
EXP :

SONDER      	San Francisco, CA

Product Manager	2020-2023

Collaborated with senior leadership team to outline the medium and long-term roadmap for the guest app.
Initiated redesigning the primary "stays" (reservations) page, which increased engagement and self-service by 15% YOY.
Introduced a series of features allowing guests to independently manage early check-in and late check-out requests.
Launched the on-demand housekeeping feature.

AIRBNB             	 San Francisco, CA
Product Manager (MBA Intern)	2019-2019

Designed and executed pilot of new consumer offering from concept to launch in five weeks
Defined user journey and technical requirements for experimental grocery feature in Sonder’s guest app, as well as operational workflows to support pilot
Created framework to evaluate 11 services, drawing on qualitative and quantitative user research to gauge demand




HELLOFRESH	 New York, NY

Product Manager	2015-2018

Successfully launched an overhaul of the core business intelligence (BI) system, used to draft and assess recipes against operational KPIs, resulting in increased efficiency and cost savings.
Reduced recipe evaluation time by approximately 30% by implementing new data integrations and UI enhancements that eliminated redundant data entry.
Developed a methodology to translate historical, regional ingredient cost data into forward-looking, national price estimates for raw ingredient SKUs, improving cost management and budget forecasting accuracy.
0.notes:
1. As a product manager at Sonder, San Francisco from 2020 to 2023, I collaborated with the senior leadership team to chart out the medium and long-term roadmap for the guest app.
2. I headed the redesign initiative of the primary "stays" page in the app which increased engagement and self-service by 15% year over year.
3. At Sonder, I also introduced features enabling guests to manage their early check-ins and late check-outs independently.
4. Under my management, we launched an on-demand housekeeping feature in the guest app.

5. I served as a product manager intern at Airbnb, San Francisco in 2019.
6. During my internship, I designed and executed the pilot of a new consumer offering from concept to launch within a span of five weeks.
7. I defined the user journey and set the technical requirements for an experimental grocery feature in Sonder’s guest app, and also worked out operational workflows to support the pilot.
8. Additionally, I created a framework to evaluate 11 different services using qualitative and quantitative user research to gauge market demand.

9. As a product manager at HelloFresh, New York from 2015 to 2018, I oversaw the successful launch of an overhaul of the main business intelligence system.
10. This overhaul and the implementation of new data integrations and UI enhancements resulted in a decrease of approximately 30% in recipe evaluation time and eliminated redundant data entry.
11. In this role, I also developed a method to convert historical, regional ingredient cost data into forward-looking, national price estimates for raw ingredient SKUs, thereby improving cost management and budget forecasting accuracy.

1.jd:
JD: Google product manager with 8 years of product management experience. 

In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds

•

You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development

•

to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information

•

We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users

•

In this role you will be responsible for AI/ML infrastructure platforms that could have transformative effects on the Generative AI and Large Language Model eco-systems, and on the Google Cloud business

•

Understand workflows of internal and external experts for our targeted workloads, specifically large scale AI/ML training, and inference

•

Understand where internal and external experts are running into limits, know how our products can best meet their needs, and shape our product roadmap by building new offerings to best drive growth to GCP

•

Work with directors and executives across Google to ensure effective product launches and experience

•

Drive product strategy and set product priorities, teaming closely with engineering and cross-functional teams to define and deliver on the next generation of cloud infrastructure services

•

Work with our Go-to-Market and field to figure out the right way to bring our innovative products to the world

1.notes:
Here are the breakdowns of my professional experience and key roles:

1. Most recently, from 2020 to 2023, I served as a Product Manager at Sonder in San Francisco, CA, where I collaborated with the senior leadership team to outline the medium and long-term roadmap for the guest app.
2. I initiated the redesign of the primary "stays" (reservations) page at Sonder, resulting in an increased engagement and self-service by 15% year-over-year.
3. I introduced a series of features at Sonder, enabling guests to manage early check-in and late check-out requests independently. 
4. At Sonder, I also launched the on-demand housekeeping feature.
5. In 2019, I was a Product Manager Intern at Airbnb in San Francisco, CA, where I designed and executed a pilot of a new consumer offering from concept to launch in just five weeks.
6. For Airbnb, I defined the user journey and technical requirements for an experimental grocery feature in Sonder’s guest app, including the operational workflows to support the pilot.
7. From 2015 to 2018, I was a Product Manager at HelloFresh in New York, NY. There I successfully launched an overhaul of the core business intelligence system, which increased efficiency and cost savings.
8. At HelloFresh, I developed a method to translate historical, regional ingredient cost data into forward-looking, national price estimates for raw ingredient SKUs. This improved cost management and budget forecasting accuracy.
9. From 2023, I served as the Principal Product Manager at Zalando in Berlin. My roles involved leading inventory distribution and building complex products.
10. From 2021 to 2022, I worked as a Group Product Manager at Getir, Berlin, where I led growth product teams focused on "Promos and referrals" and "Address UX" improving order cancellations by 18%.
11. In 2021, I co-founded Blok in Barcelona, where I led Product and Growth and acquired 10000 customers with a 30% stickiness and 12% activation rate.
12. From 2018 to 2021, I served as a Product Lead at Mercedes-Benz.io in Berlin, where I led a product team of 30 full-time employees to launch and grow the Bertha app to 1million downloads with a retention rate of 40%.
13. Between 2016 and 2018, at Clark Germany in Berlin, I worked as a Product Owner and Head of Digital Marketing where I acquired and retained more than 80,000 customers and led user activation and retention initiatives.
14. In the early stage of my career from 2009 to 2011, I worked as an Assistant Systems Engineer at Tata Consultancy Services.
1.explanation:
Because this position requires 8 years of product management experience, the resume should benefit from the applicant's extensive history in product management roles across various companies such as Zalando, Getir, Blok, Mercedes-Benz.io, and Clark Germany, showing that the applicant has significantly more than 8 years of experience in the field. 

Because the role involves working cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch, the applicant's experience as a Co-Founder/Chief Growth Officer at Blok and Group Product Manager at Getir demonstrates the capability to lead cross-functional teams and initiatives, showing alignment with this requirement.

Because the role necessitates breaking down complex problems into steps that drive product development, the applicant's experience in leading inventory distribution at Zalando and building complex products focused on returns management and lead time improvements showcases the required skill in simplifying and tackling multifaceted problems.

Because the position requires understanding workflows and innovations in AI/ML training for cloud infrastructure services, the applicant's Principal Product Manager role at Zalando, leading inventory distribution algorithms and experimentation for Group portfolio, indicates a strong background in handling data-driven and technological challenges relevant to AI/ML.

Because effective product launch experience is crucial, the applicant's track record at Mercedes-Benz.io, where they led a product team to launch the Bertha app to 1 million downloads, illustrates their capability to navigate product launches successfully.

Because the job description outlines responsibilities involving product strategy and setting product priorities, closely teaming with engineering and cross-functional teams, the resume reflects a strong fit with prior roles like Product and Growth Leader at Zalando and Clark Germany, where strategic planning and collaboration with diverse teams were essential.

Because the role involves shaping the product roadmap and driving growth to Google Cloud Platform (GCP), the applicant's background as a Co-Founder/Chief Growth Officer acquiring 10,000 customers with a sticky product and leading growth teams at Getir that improved funnel conversion demonstrates expertise in driving product growth and user acquisition, which is key to increasing GCP's market share.

Lastly, because the role entails working with Go-to-Market and field teams to position innovative products, the applicant's history in Digital Marketing with InMobi and Mobile Marketing with Zalando+Rocket Internet, where they partnered with giants like Google and Facebook, suggests they have the experience in marketing and launching products successfully to a broad audience.

CAPITAL ONE      	San Francisco, CA

Guide initiatives and projects across 13 B2B Solutions teams, ensuring they comply with project management standards
Keep an eye on all project activities to make sure they follow the plan, including the timeline, risks, and legal requirements, from start to finish
Improve product operations processes to get faster feedback, increase efficiency, and boost feature use
Develop useful project management tools like project plans, brainstorming templates, task trackers, and more for use across the organization
Work together with PMOs across the company, sharing knowledge and resources


MCKINSEY              	 San Francisco, CA

2.notes:
At Sonder where I was based in San Francisco, CA, I served as a Product Manager from 2020 to 2023. I had the opportunity to collaborate with the senior leadership team to outline medium and long-term roadmaps for the guest app. I initiated a redesign of the primary "stays" page which lead to a 15% YOY increase in engagement and self-service. 

Additionally, I worked with Airbnb in San Francisco, CA, as a Product Manager intern in 2019. There, I designed and executed a pilot of a new consumer offering, defining the user journey and technical requirements for an experimental grocery feature in Sonder’s guest app.

Earlier in New York, NY, at HelloFresh, I held a Product Manager position from 2015 to 2018. I successfully launched an overhaul of the core business intelligence system and increased efficiency by reducing recipe evaluation time by 30% through data integrations and UI enhancements.

At Zalando in Berlin, I was a Principal Product Manager in 2023 where I lead efforts in inventory distribution and return management. Also, I led a growth product team focused on "Promos and referrals" and "Address UX" on the Getir App at Getir in Berlin from 2021 to 2022. 

Furthermore, I co-founded Blok, serving as the Chief Growth Officer, where we acquired 10000 customers with 30% stickiness and a 12% activation rate before it was acquired by Getir in July 2021. 

With Mercedes-Benz.io, I led a product team of 30 full-time employees as a Product Lead from 2018 to 2021. We launched the Bertha app which currently holds 1M downloads.

During 2016-2018, I worked with Clark Germany as Product Owner and Head of Digital Marketing where we acquired and retained more than 80,000 customers and built a direct sales funnel to sell insurances online. 

At Capital One in San Francisco, CA, as a Product Manager, I led the use of OKRs across 13 B2B Solutions teams from 2020 to 2023. I took charge of initiatives and projects while ensuring that they met our organization's project management standards.

I also had the opportunity to be a Project Administrator Intern at McKinsey, San Francisco, CA, in 2019 where I managed various financial and project tasks, supported staff during research proposal development, and offered operational support.
2.explanation:
Because this position requires a product manager with 3 years of experience, the resume should benefit from the extensive experience of the applicant in product management roles since 2015, including positions at Sonder, Airbnb, HelloFresh, Zalando, Getir, Mercedes-Benz.io, Clark Germany, and Capital One, demonstrating a strong and diverse background in product management across various industries and markets.

Because Amazon values data-driven decision making, the resume should stand out by describing specific quantifiable achievements, such as a "15% YOY increase in engagement," "reducing recipe evaluation time by 30%," acquiring "10000 customers with 30% stickiness and a 12% activation rate," and launching an app with "1M downloads."

Because Amazon looks for leadership abilities, the resume highlights leadership in roles such as leading a "product team of 30 full-time employees," "guiding initiatives and projects across 13 B2B Solutions teams," and "leading efforts in inventory distribution and return management," which showcase the candidate's capability to steer complex product strategies and manage sizeable teams effectively.

Lastly, the candidate's background in utilizing OKRs (Objectives and Key Results), a methodology likely valued by Amazon for setting and tracking objectives, as well as experience in enhancing "product operations processes," will resonate well with Amazon's goal-oriented and process improvement culture.

Furthermore, I co-founded Blok, serving as the Chief Growth Officer, where we acquired 10000 customers with 30% stickiness and a 12% activation rate before it was acquired by Getir in July 2021. 

With Mercedes-Benz.io, I led a product team of 30 full-time employees as a Product Lead from 2018 to 2021. We launched the Bertha app which currently holds 1M downloads.

During 2016-2018, I worked with Clark Germany as Product Owner and Head of Digital Marketing where we acquired and retained more than 80,000 customers and built a direct sales funnel to sell insurances online. 

At Capital One in San Francisco, CA, as a Product Manager, I led the use of OKRs across 13 B2B Solutions teams from 2020 to 2023. I took charge of initiatives and projects while ensuring that they met our organization's project management standards.

I also had the opportunity to be a Project Administrator Intern at McKinsey, San Francisco, CA, in 2019 where I managed various financial and project tasks, supported staff during research proposal development, and offered operational support.

Explanation: Because this position requires a product manager with 3 years of experience, the resume should benefit from the extensive experience of the applicant in product management roles since 2015, including positions at Sonder, Airbnb, HelloFresh, Zalando, Getir, Mercedes-Benz.io, Clark Germany, and Capital One, demonstrating a strong and diverse background in product management across various industries and markets.

Because Amazon values data-driven decision making, the resume should stand out by describing specific quantifiable achievements, such as a "15% YOY increase in engagement," "reducing recipe evaluation time by 30%," acquiring "10000 customers with 30% stickiness and a 12% activation rate," and launching an app with "1M downloads."

Because Amazon looks for leadership abilities, the resume highlights leadership in roles such as leading a "product team of 30 full-time employees," "guiding initiatives and projects across 13 B2B Solutions teams," and "leading efforts in inventory distribution and return management," which showcase the candidate's capability to steer complex product strategies and manage sizeable teams effectively.

Lastly, the candidate's background in utilizing OKRs (Objectives and Key Results), a methodology likely valued by Amazon for setting and tracking objectives, as well as experience in enhancing "product operations processes," will resonate well with Amazon's goal-oriented and process improvement culture.

3.notes:
My current position is as a Product Manager at Sonder in San Francisco, a role I've held since 2020. In this role, I've worked closely with the senior leadership team to develop medium and long-term strategies for the guest app. One of my significant accomplishments was initiating a redesign of the primary reservations page leading to an increase in engagement and self-service by 15% YOY. I also introduced new features allowing guests to manage early check-in and late check-out requests independently, and I successfully implemented an on-demand housekeeping feature.

Before Sonder, I was an MBA intern at Airbnb in San Francisco in 2019. During my internship, I was instrumental in designing and launching a new consumer offering within five weeks, from concept development to execution. I also defined user journeys and technical requirements for a novel grocery feature in Sonder's guest app and devised operational workflows to support the pilot.

My portfolio extends to Hello Fresh in New York, where I served as the Product Manager between 2015 to 2018. I notably launched an overhaul of the core business intelligence (BI) system used to assess and draft recipes against operational KPIs, making an impact on efficiency and cost savings. I also brought changes that reduced recipe evaluation time by approximately 30% and improved cost management and budget forecasting accuracy.

Enriching my work experience, I worked at Zalando in Berlin as the Principal Product Manager in 2023. I spearheaded the development of complex products focused on returns management, lead time improvements, and “Flawless choice”.

I also worked with other brands like Getir in Berlin, where I was a Group Product Manager in 2021-2022, focusing on 'Promos and referrals' and 'Address UX', that improved funnel conversion and reduced order cancellations. In Blok, Barcelona, I co-founded the company and served as the Chief Growth Officer in 2021. My efforts were instrumental in product growth, leading to a customer base of over 10,000 customers with a 30% stickiness rate and a 12% activation rate.

I worked with Mercedes-Benz.io in Berlin as a Product Lead from 2018 to 2021, where I led a product team of 30 FTE to launch and grow the Bertha app to 1 million downloads, 40% retention, and 4.5 stars in app stores. 

My professional experience begins with a role as Assistant Systems Engineer with Tata Consultancy Services from 2009-2011, followed by Digital Marketing with InMobi in Bangalore from 2013-2015. Further, with Zalando+Rocket Internet in Berlin from 2016-2018, I focused on mobile user acquisition and retention, partnering with Google and Facebook.

In San Francisco, at Capital One, I worked as a Product Manager for B2B Payments from 2020 to 2023, where I lead the incorporation of OKRs in the organization and shaped initiatives across the B2B Solutions teams. 

Later, I worked as a Project Administrator with McKinsey in San Francisco in 2019, managing financial tracking for large-scale projects and developing various financial models and analytics. I also served at Paylocity as a Senior Product Designer since 2022, leading functional design and implementations for global tech clients and being the liaison between technical and client business teams.

Overseas in London, England, I worked with Pearl as an SEO Program Manager in 2018 and 2019, leading remote teams focused on SEO analysis, keyword research, and content creation. 

Finally, at WebApp in Philadelphia, PA, I took on the role of Product Manager in 2020 and managed various projects in mobile app development, SEO, web design, and cloud development for internationally diverse clients.

The applicant has notably served as a Product Manager at Sonder (since 2020), showing longevity and advancement within the same company. Additionally, past roles at Hello Fresh, Getir, and Mercedes-Benz.io as Product Manager or higher, including Principal Product Manager and Product Lead, highlight a rich history of management experience. This range of roles not only displays the required experience but also suggests a robust skill set in managing and launching products and features.

Because the role involves collaboration with engineering and design teams, the applicant's experience working closely with senior leadership and developing strategies for Sonder's guest app aligns well, as does their background in leading a product team at Mercedes-Benz.io.

Because the role includes improving user experience and consumer differentiation, the redesign accomplishment at Sonder that increased engagement by 15% YOY is particularly relevant. Furthermore, the successful launch and growth achievements at Mercedes-Benz.io (e.g., 1 million downloads) showcase their ability to deliver consumer-focused results.

Because the prospective job involves positioning apps in the competitive landscape and crafting compelling messaging, the applicant's experience in defining product roadmaps and strategies, as well as working with Marketing Communications, Public Relations, and Events teams at Sonder, indicates relevancy and competence in these areas.

Because new product development based on research, technology trends, and user feedback is key, the prior role at Airbnb where the applicant designed and launched a consumer offering within five weeks evidences their ability to quickly synthesize information and act on it. The mention of establishing an overhaul of the BI system at Hello Fresh indicates proficiency with analytics, which is crucial for understanding trends and insights.

Because the position requires global coordination for product launches, the international experience displayed through roles at Pearl in London, Paylocity working with global tech clients, and managing projects for a diverse clientele at WebApp in Philadelphia will be advantageous.

Because this role entails acting as an ambassador for FaceTime and Phone apps, the applicant's customer-facing initiatives, such as the independent management features for guests at Sonder, and press briefings and customer visits experience at Mercedes-Benz.io, are directly transferable.

Overall, the resume shows a consistent trajectory of escalating responsibility in product management, coupled with relevant accomplishments and international exposure that fit the job description's requirements for an Apple Product Manager, positioning the candidate as a strong contender for the role.

﻿JD:
WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH:


Imagine a role that tests and develops your academic and personal capabilities every day of the week, presents you with the most interesting challenges and provides you the warmest, brightest and most supportive peer group to face them with. You’ll make an impact from day one and be set on a global career path that will maximize your future career potential.


We have a long tradition of solving the most challenging problems with notable industry leaders and our Associate Consultants form the backbone of this success. If you’re an ambitious student who enjoys working with the brightest, most curious minds then we’d love you to join our team.


WHAT YOU’LL DO:


As a Bain Associate Consultant, your analytical, inter-personal, creative thinking, business management and leadership skills will be called upon from day one. You will begin as a generalist and be in the thick of the action as you work side-by-side with some of the best in the business. Every day is different but a sample of the things you can expect to accomplish are:


Provide clients with powerful facts and analyses that outline solutions and drive change
Work on case teams in roles that vary according to the team’s objective
Be responsible for identifying information sources, gathering, and interpreting data, and presenting your findings to case team members
Interviewing the client’s customers, competitors, suppliers, and employees; this work becomes the basis of the case team’s strategic recommendation
The learning curve is steep, but from over 50 years of experience, we know that you will be able to handle it. And the rewards – global travel, influential connections, world-class training, personal satisfaction, unparalleled career development and, yes, financial – are second to none.


ABOUT YOU:


The following are typical requirements for the Associate Consultant position. Please check our office information for exact deadlines, any office-specific requirements and office information.


University degree from a renowned educational institution 
A solid team player who’s also an independent thinker 
A robust analytical skill set, endless curiosity and a penchant to think the impossible
Must be deadline driven, organized and able to multi-task
Strong verbal, written and presentation skills are important
Fluency in English
Any additional language and visa requirements for the office you wish to join

I also developed a novel methodology to translate regional ingredient cost data into national price estimates for raw ingredient SKUs.

4. In Berlin at Zalando, I held the position of a Principal Product Manager in 2023. I led the Inventory Distribution department, focusing on building complex products around returns management and other initiatives. 

5. I was Group Product Manager at Getir in Berlin from 2021 to 2022, where I led growth product teams focusing on promotions, refinery logistics, and user interface on the Getir App across 9 markets.

6. At Mercedes-Benz.io in Berlin, I served as a Product Lead from 2018 to 2021, where I led a product team of 30 full-time employees to launch and grow the Bertha app, leading to 1 million downloads, 40% retention rate, and 4.5 stars in app stores.

7. I was the Co-Founder/Chief Growth Officer at Blok in Barcelona in 2021, where we acquired over 10,000 customers, showing a 30% stickiness rate and a 12% activation rate. The company was acquired by Getir the same year.

8. From 2016 to 2018 at Clark Germany in Berlin, I was the Product Owner and Head of Digital Marketing, where we acquired and retained over 80,000 customers through numerous user activation and retention initiatives.

9. At Capital One in San Francisco, I was a Product Manager for B2B Payments from 2020 to 2023. I led the use of Objectives and Key Results (OKRs) in the organization, and guided initiatives across 13 B2B Solutions teams, ensuring compliance with project management standards.

10. During my tenure at McKinsey in San Francisco as a Project Administrator (MBA Intern) in 2019, I managed multiple financial and project-oriented tasks, including creating ad-hoc financial models, preparing budgets, and overseeing several company portfolios.

11. At Paylocity, I am currently working remotely as a Senior Product Designer since 2022. My role revolves around various infrastructure tasks for global tech clients, building firm relationships with higher-ranked executives on engagements, and serving as a liaison between technical and client business teams.

12. At my most recent stint with 1 Well 700 Lives, I served as the founder. From April 2009 to November 2017, the organization provided clean drinking water to over 25,000 people in 36 different villages in Afghanistan. I raised over US$72,000 to build water wells by connecting with potential donors.

13. I also acted as Vice President at TEDxBrownU in Providence, RI from April 2015 to March 2018, where I led a team of volunteers to curate TEDx conferences and increased attendance by 25% to 100 people.

5.jd:
JD:
Company Description
Since we opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely, and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take payments and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn’t work together.


To solve this problem, we expanded into software and built integrated solutions to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. Across it all, we’ve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow in one place. Afterpay furthers our goal to provide omnichannel tools that unlock meaningful value and growth, enabling sellers to capture the next generation shopper, increase order sizes, and compete at a larger scale.


Today, we are a partner to sellers of all sizes – large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex operations, sellers just starting, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers grow, so do our solutions. There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We’re building a significant, meaningful, and lasting business, and we are helping sellers worldwide do the same.
Job Description
The restaurant industry is at an inflection point where technology is becoming more important than ever in shaping a restaurant's success. The Square for Restaurants team is helping restaurants build and grow smart businesses that can shapeshift to adapt to evolving diner demands, all while maintaining a sense of hospitality.


You will report to the Head of Product, Restaurants and focus on helping restaurants start, run and grow their businesses through building products that automate and elevate every part of the flow of their service.


To be successful in this role, you should be able to transform a deep empathy of a restaurant's needs and pains into elegant software, to think tactically and strategically, to manage deep cross-functional collaboration and execution. You must also be able to drive growth metrics and own the details of the solution from deep in the stack through the end-user experience.


If you're looking to work at a high-growth company, drive impact on widely used products and change the way the restaurant industry works on a global scale you will find this role compelling, challenging, and rewarding.


You Will:


Work closely with restaurant owners and staff to deeply understand their needs, what keeps them up at night and how they run their business and serve their diners.
In collaboration with design, engineering, marketing, and analytics partners, lead the end-to-end success of projects from discovery to launch
Identify new growth opportunities through quantitative research, UX studies, and reviews of industry standard methodologies
Influence and inspire key stakeholders and cross-functional peers and executives throughout Square to align intent, resources, and prioritization and deliver excellent products and services
Qualifications
You Have:


Minimum of 3 years of consumer-facing product management experience
Passion for our purpose of economic empowerment and helping sellers succeed
Strong customer empathy and experience shaping product direction based on customer needs
Create solid relationships that shine when you're talking with a customer, cross-functional partner, or engaging a diverse audience
Natural curiosity and growth mindset, obsession with the details
Navigated product scale challenges in a high growth environment
Proven experience delivering results

5.notes:
My most recent experience is with a company called Sonder based in San Francisco, CA, where I worked as a Product Manager between 2020 and 2023. I successfully collaborated with the senior leadership team to outline a medium and long-term roadmap for their guest app. This includes the redesign of the main 'stays' page, which led to an increase in customer engagement and self-service by 15% YOY. Additionally, I introduced some features that allowed guests to manage early check-in and late check-out requests independently. Also, I launched an on-demand housekeeping feature.

Before Sonder, I worked as an MBA intern in the role of Product Manager at Airbnb during 2019. During this tenure, I conceptualised and executed a pilot consumer offering in only five weeks. I also defined the technical requirements and user journey for an experimental grocery feature in Sonder's guest app. In addition, I created a framework that evaluated 11 services based on qualitative and quantitative user research.

From 2015 to 2018, I worked as a Product Manager at HelloFresh based in New York, NY. During this period, I launched an overhaul of the business intelligence system, which led to efficiency increases and cost savings. I implemented improvements in data integrations and UI enhancements, which reduced recipe evaluation time by about 30%. This eliminated redundant data entries. I also developed a methodology for translating regional ingredient cost data into national projections.

I've also had experience in Berlin at Zalando as Principal Product Manager in 2023. Here, I led inventory distribution and built complex products focused on returns management, lead time improvements and flawless choice. I spearheaded experimentation and discovery for group portfolio initiatives, leading three experiments with dozens of stakeholders.

I worked as the Chief Growth Officer at Blok in Barcelona during 2021. During this period, I led product and growth initiatives, resulting in the successful acquisition of 10,000 customers, 30% stickiness, and a 12% activation rate. The company was subsequently acquired by Getir in July 2021.

My experience also includes working as the Product Lead at Mercedes-Benz.io from 2018 to 2021. I led a team of 30 FTE to launch and grow the Bertha app to 1M downloads, 40% retention, and 4.5 stars in app stores.

From 2020 to 2023, I worked for Capital One in San Francisco, CA. As a Product Manager for B2B Payments, I implemented the use of OKRs in the organization. I monitored project activities and ensured compliance with the timeline, risks, and legal requirements.

In 2019, I worked as a Project Administrator Intern at McKinsey, where I managed financial and project tasks. I supported hiring, onboarding activities, and event coordination.

Recently, I served as a Senior Product Designer at Paylocity where I orchestrated Invoice to Cash I2C for global tech clients.

My experience also includes roles with Pearl as an SEO Program Manager, and with WebApp as a Product Manager. 

I have a strong record of business analytics and client-related experience. I have interned at Pamir Energy and Altman Vilandrie & Co. In addition, I provided access to clean drinking water to over 25,000 people in 36 different villages in Afghanistan as the founder of 1 Well 700 Lives.

My significant leadership experience includes being the Vice President of TEDxBrownU and the President of Buxton International House. Lastly, I was a Strategy Intern at CO OP Brand Partners. All these roles have equipped me with skills necessary to excel in the role I am applying for.
5.explanation:
Because this position requires a minimum of 3 years of consumer-facing product management experience, the resume should benefit from the applicant's roles at Brex and Microsoft as a Product Manager, which makes them not only relevant but also recent (May 2022 - Present and July 2019 - May 2022 respectively). The achievements such as a "10% increase in onboarding rates" and growing "active usage from 1000 to 1 million monthly users in 1 year" align with the needs of driving growth metrics for Square.

Because the role desires strong customer empathy and shaping product direction based on customer needs, the candidate's experience at Sonder where they improved customer engagement by 15% YOY, and the product management role at Airbnb focusing on consumer offerings, directly showcase a track record in customer-centric product development. This alignment with customer empathy is further supported by the 20 user research interviews conducted as a co-founder of Pampr.us to develop an AI-based skincare recommendations app.

Because the candidate must work closely with restaurant staff to deeply understand their needs, the resume benefits from the experiences of leading a team of 30 at Mercedes-Benz.io to launch and grow a product (the Bertha app), and implementing user-centric features at Sonder such as the on-demand housekeeping feature. This shows a strong precedent of engaging directly with user needs and implementing solutions.

Because the role requires the ability to navigate product scale challenges in a high growth environment, the resume is strong due to the candidate's role at Microsoft leading to a drastic increase of users to 1 million in just a year, and substantial product growth initiatives like those witnessed with the Bertha app which achieved 1M downloads and a 40% retention rate.

Because there's a need for statistical and analytic understanding, the resume will be successful due to the applicant's time at the HCI Lab at Brown University, where they designed predictive sleep models analyzing over 10 million nights of sleep data, which demonstrates a solid foundation in data analytics.

Because the candidate must possess a natural curiosity and growth mindset, the various leadership roles they have taken on, including those at World Economic Forum, Pampr.us, and Humans AI, reflect a strong entrepreneurial spirit and proven initiative to start and grow various ventures.

In summary, the extensive product management experience, evidence of successful consumer-centric product improvements, the leadership abilities demonstrated through various roles, and analytical prowess from substantial data analysis projects all make this resume well-suited for the product role at Square for Restaurants, which seeks to help restaurants start, run, and grow their businesses through integrated solutions.

Assisted in developing algorithms for company's Multi-Asset Execution Management Systems (MAEMS).
Implemented various financial derivative models in the quantitative analysis of private equity investments using C++ programming.
Created formal modeling of risk, return and trading cost profiles for equities and other firm-wide assets classes.

CITIC Securities Co. Ltd.
Credit Risk Model Validation Analyst


Extensively tested the risk models including sensitivity analysis, extreme value testing, uncertainty analysis, backtesting, and benchmarking to challenge the models effectively.
Evaluated the model use appropriateness in the context of CCAR/DFAST.
Found inappropriate use of equity replication model in the counterparty credit risk exposure project, and debugged it.
Wrote comprehensive independent validation reports explaining the analysis performed and their results.
6.notes:
I carry approximately five years of experience as a Product Manager in various firms. I served as a Product Manager at Sonder, San Francisco from 2020 to 2023. In this role, I worked closely with the senior leadership team to plan the medium and long-term roadmap for the guest application. I took the initiative to redesign the primary "stays" page, which increased user interaction and self-service by 15% year on year. I also introduced features allowing guests to independently manage early check-in and late check-out requests and launched an on-demand housekeeping feature.

Before Sonder, I had served as a Product Manager (Intern) at Airbnb in 2019. In this role, I executed a new consumer offering from its concept to its launch, all in just five weeks. I defined the user journey, technical requirements and operational workflows for a grocery feature in Sonder's guest application. 

From 2015 to 2018, I held the position of a Product Manager at HelloFresh in New York, where I re-architectured the core business intelligence (BI) system leading to a more efficient and cost-effective recipe drafting and assessment process. This revamp resulted in a 30% reduction in recipe evaluation time due to new data integrations and UI enhancements designed to eliminate unnecessary data entry.

Currently, I am working as a Product and Growth leader at Zalando, Berlin, where I lead inventory distributions and build complex products focussed on returns management, lead time improvements, and "Flawless choice", enablement of MCF/B2B in ZEOS.

From 2018 to 2021, I worked as a Product Lead at Mercedes-Benz.io, Berlin, where I led a team of 30 full-time employees to launch and grow the Bertha app which acquired 1 million downloads, 40% retention, and a rating of 4.5 stars in app stores.

I was also the Co-Founder and Chief Growth Officer at Blok in Barcelona in 2021, where under my leadership, we acquired 10000 customers with a 30% stickiness and an activation rate of 12%.

In terms of education, I have an MBA degree and have served various internships in my field during my MBA studies. I believe my practical experience and theoretical knowledge align perfectly with the job requirements. 

In terms of skills, I excel in strategic initiative prioritization, project management, excellent verbal and written communication, problem-solving and analytical abilities.
6.explanation:
Because this position requires an expert in a high-level programming language such as Python or R, the resume should benefit from the candidate's experience with numerical approaches in pricing financial derivatives, which likely required programming skills, as well as their implementation of financial derivative models using C++ programming during their internship. This demonstrates a strong foundation in programming, which is transferable to the desired languages.

Because the position demands a detailed understanding of Market Microstructure, the resume should be favorable as the candidate has worked as a Quantitative Analyst at Citigroup Inc., where they would have engaged with financial markets, pricing, and trading concepts that are core to market microstructure knowledge.

Because experience analyzing OTC data and Exchange Traded Data is needed, the resume should stand out because of the candidate's experience with pricing financial derivatives and assisting managers with trade approvals at Citigroup Inc., activities that would have involved the analysis of these types of data.

Because the position requires a strong academic record in a related field, the resume benefits from the candidate's MBA degree, which frequently has a high mathematical, statistical, and computing content that aligns with the mentioned degrees in the job description.

Because 5+ years of experience trading in a financial institution is required, their experience across various firms as a Product Manager involved in strategic decision-making, market analysis, and product optimization speaks to a profound understanding of market dynamics, even if it is not direct trading experience.

Because the position involves hands-on work across technology and projects, the resume is enriched by the candidate's demonstrated hands-on attitude through their work in designing and launching new product features, revamping BI systems, and leading teams to develop apps and manage inventory, showing a willingness to engage with different aspects of technology and project management.

Finally, the position calls for strong interpersonal skills to enable communication across teams, which aligns well with the resume showcasing the candidate's leadership at Mercedes-Benz.io and growth achievements at Zalando and Blok, indicating their ability to effectively communicate and work with diverse teams. 

In summary, while the candidate's background as a Product Manager differs from the traditional trajectory of a Quantitative Trader, their robust technical skills, strategic leadership experience and academic credentials are all relevant and beneficial to the role described.

7.jd:
JD:
Software engineer StubHub
StubHub is on a mission to redefine the live event experience on a global scale. Whether someone is looking to attend their first event or their hundredth, we’re here to delight them all the way from the moment they start looking for a ticket until they step through the gate. The same goes for our sellers. From fans selling a single ticket to the promoters of a worldwide stadium tour, we want StubHub to be the safest, most convenient way to offer a ticket to the millions of fans who browse our platform around the world. 
 
StubHub is looking for Software Engineer IIs to design and develop next-generation technologies and complex features. As a Software Engineer at StubHub, you will be at the forefront of tackling significant, ambiguous, and non-trivial challenges as a core contributor and innovator, bringing creative technical solutions to life. In order to ensure our company's success, our Software Engineers must demonstrate initiative and enthusiasm for the problems they tackle. 
 
As a Software Engineer II, you will design and implement systems and services with an eye for elegance, maintainability, and practicality. Over the course of your career at the company, you will have the opportunity to contribute to diverse projects and the needs of the business. The best candidates and most successful team members exhibit versatility, a growth mindset, ability to learn, and enthusiasm in tackling new challenges across the company. 


About the team:
StubHub has two types of customers - buyers and sellers. Sellers come here to make money - and Payouts Team owns everything around making it happen! That includes making sure our sellers get paid the correct amount, in correct currency, via correct payment method, as quickly as possible and within the specific business requirements set for them by the business. At the same time, since the team is responsible for any and all outgoing payments, they are tasked protecting the cash - as it would be catastrophic if something were to go wrong.
What You'll Do
Design, develop, test, deploy, and maintain impactful improvements across StubHub's platforms and products 
Demonstrate consistently executing with agility resulting in high-quality outcomes 
Manage individual initiative priorities, deadlines, and deliverables with your technical expertise, and set an example for technical excellence on your team  
Participate in and maintain culture of inclusion, results-oriented execution, open innovation, and limitless creativity in your team 
Launch features that have immediate impact on the velocity of innovation and ultimately growth of the business 
Your Growth Path:
Receive mentorship and a clear path for growing your technical and leadership skills   
Demonstrated results and increasing ownership are rewarded   
You’ll have the chance to join new teams and learn more about the organization   
Become a senior engineer who can progress into architecture and management   
What You've Done
3-5 years, or equivalent demonstration, of full-time relevant work experience in software development 
Experience in designing and developing robust, distributed systems using multiple general-purpose programming languages (e.g., Java, C#, Python, Javascript) 
Experience designing and developing solutions to complex problems with significant business impact 
Proven ability to learn other coding languages, platforms, frameworks, and tools 
Understanding of the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

● Designed and user-tested rules for matching drivers to riders, ordering trip results and driver-rider conflict resolution

7.notes:
1. I have around three years of experience working as a Product Manager at Sonder in San Francisco, California from 2020 to 2023. During this time, I partnered with the senior leadership team to devise the medium and long-term roadmap for the guest app. I led the initiative to redesign the "stays" page, boosting engagement and self-service by 15%. I introduced a feature that allowed guests to manage early check-in and late check-out requests independently. Moreover, I was responsible for the successful launch of the on-demand housekeeping feature.

2. Prior to my tenure at Sonder, I also worked as a Product Manager intern for Airbnb in San Francisco in 2019. In this capacity, I designed and implemented a pilot project for a new consumer offering within five weeks from concept to launch. I defined the user journey and technical details for an experimental grocery feature in Sonder's guest app, as well as the necessary operational workflows to support the pilot. I developed a framework to evaluate 11 services, utilizing both qualitative and quantitative user research to assess demand.

3. Before my roles in San Francisco, I served as a Product Manager for HelloFresh in New York from 2015 to 2018. In this role, I succeeded in launching an overhaul of the company's Business Intelligence system, which significantly improved efficiency and reduced costs. I implemented new data integrations and UI enhancements that reduced recipe evaluation time by approximately 30%. I also developed a methodology to translate historical regional ingredient cost data into forward-looking national price estimates for raw ingredient SKUs, improving cost management and budget forecasting accuracy.

4. I also have international experience. I served as a Principal Product Manager at Zalando in Berlin in 2023, where I focused on inventory distribution and complex products centered on returns management, lead time improvements, and enabling MCF/B2B in ZEOS. I also led experimentation and discovery initiatives like "fast and for me".

5. In addition, I am experienced in growth strategy. I served as a Group Product Manager for Getir in Berlin from 2021 to 2022. I led growth product teams focusing on "Promos and referrals" and "Address UX" on the Getir App for all 9 markets, which improved funnel conversion by 8% and reduced order cancellations by 18%.

6. I also have entrepreneurial experience. I co-founded a company called Blok in Barcelona, where I served as the Chief Growth Officer in 2021. The company was acquired by Getir in 2021. During my tenure there, I led product and growth strategies and acquired 10,000 customers with 30% stickiness, and a 12% activation rate.

7. I was also a Product Lead at Mercedes-Benz.io in Berlin from 2018 to 2021. I led a product team of 30 FTE to launch and grow the Bertha app to 1M downloads, with 40% retention and 4.5 stars in app stores. 

8. From 2020 to 2023, I worked as a Product Manager for B2B payments at Capital One in San Francisco, CA. During my tenure here, I led the implementation of OKRs across the organization and ensured all project activities followed the plan, including the timeline, risks, and legal requirements. 

9. I have interned with McKinsey in San Francisco, CA, as a Project Administrator during 2019. My responsibilities included tracking financial data for large-scale projects, creating financial models and analytics, budget preparation, managing timelines, and liaising with stakeholders.

10. From 2018 to 2019, I was an SEO Program Manager at Pearl in London, where I directed remote global teams focusing on SEO and SEM.

11. I have a host of other experience, including my time as President at Buxton International House in Providence, RI, Vice President at TEDxBrownU, and Strategy Intern at CO OP Brand Partners in New York, NY, among others.
7.explanation:
Because this position requires a Software Engineer II with 3-5 years of full-time relevant work experience in software development, the resume should benefit from the applicant's employment as a Software Engineer II at AppDynamics, demonstrating technical expertise in Python, FastAPI, Docker, and Kubernetes over a period that overlaps this timeframe. Additionally, experience with high-throughput services using Kafka and involvement in developing core algorithms for Anomaly Detection and Root Cause Analysis directly aligns with the job description's emphasis on complex features and systems design.

Because the job emphasizes the design, development, testing, deploying, and maintenance of improvements across platforms, the resume should benefit from the applicant's cross-collaboration with architecture and database teams, co-designing services, and the deployment of Python services, all of which highlight a strong understanding of the software development lifecycle. 

Because the position values versatility and a growth mindset, the resume should benefit from a broad range of experiences including leadership roles, technical and behavioral interviews for hiring, and the development of diverse applications (e.g., NixorConnect, Hopp, Giving), showcasing an ability to learn and adapt to new challenges.

Because the position at StubHub resides within a team focused on payouts and involves ensuring correct and quick payments, the resume should benefit from the applicant's experience with payments and financial systems at Capital One, where they led the implementation of OKRs and managed legal requirements, paralleling the responsibilities of protecting cash flows in the Payouts Team at StubHub.

Because the role requires experience with multiple general-purpose programming languages and technological versatility, the resume should benefit from the demonstration of the applicant's technical proficiency across various technologies (e.g., Java, JavaScript, Kubernetes, etc.), and their successful deployment of services and applications in different contexts, which speaks to their adaptability and proficiency in software development.
